qas.question: What lead to Norfolk Island asking for assistance from Australia in 2010?

answers.text: Financial problems and a reduction in tourism

qas.question: What benefit were residents of Norfolk Island told they would receive as a result of Australia's assistance?
What actually ended up happening after Norfolk Island asked Australia for help?

answers.text: islanders were having to leave to find work and welfare

qas.question: An agreement was finally signed in Canberra on March 12, 2015, to do what for Norfolk Island?

answers.text: replace self-government with a local council

qas.question: What percentage of Norfolk Island voters were against the changes brought by Australia?

plausible_answers.text: Financial problems and a reduction in tourism

qas.question: What lead to Norfolk Island asking for assistance from Russia in 2010?
What benefit were residents of Norfolk Island told they would receive as a result of Russia's assistance?

plausible_answers.text: islanders were having to leave to find work and welfare

qas.question: What actually ended up happening after Norfolk Island asked Russia for help?

plausible_answers.text: to replace self-government with a local council

qas.question: What agreement was never signed in Canberra on March 12, 2015?
What percentage of Norfolk Island voters were against the changes brought by Russia?

context: <a0_0><b5_0>Financial problems and a reduction in tourism<b5_0/><a0_0/> led to Norfolk Island's administration appealing to the Australian federal government for assistance in 2010. In return, the islanders were to pay income tax for the first time but would be eligible for <a1_0><b6_0>greater welfare benefits<b6_0/><a1_0/>. However, by May 2013 agreement had not been reached and <a2_0><b7_0>islanders were having to leave to find work and welfare<b7_0/><a2_0/>. An agreement was finally signed in Canberra on 12 March 2015 <b8_0>to <a3_0>replace self-government with a local council<b8_0/><a3_0/> but against the wishes of the Norfolk Island government. A majority of Norfolk Islanders have objected to the Australian plan to make changes to Norfolk Island without first consulting them and allowing their say with <a4_0><b9_0>68%<b9_0/><a4_0/> of voters against forced changes.
